intro: Leiotulus nydeggeri, commonly known as the Nydegger's leiotulus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features include hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves that are often glandular-dotted. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
